summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing travel approval and logistics for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It references prior travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Dale
persons.context: Sends an email on January 24, 2020, discussing hotel preferences for the Stockholm trip, mentioning that if traveling with another person, she would prefer the Hotel Kung Carl.

persons.name: Edward
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Edward (USANYS)) on a December 2019 travel request email for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on an April 2019 email chain where a travel request for the Epstein investigation is approved.

connections.description: Dale references traveling with an unnamed colleague (referred to as '=, she') and discusses their hotel preferences for the Stockholm trip.
Both are part of the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) correspondence regarding travel approval for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The email chain discusses travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation, planned for January 29th and/or 30th, 2020.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel was requested for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel was requested for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel was requested for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel was requested for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively scheduled for a week in June 2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel was requested for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is part of the Epstein investigation case 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
In January 2020, U.S. Attorney's Office personnel were planning international travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview, indicating the investigation's ongoing and international scope.
The emails reference multiple prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach throughout 2019.
Travel logistics include discussions about hotel options (Sheraton vs. Hotel Kung Carl), flight bookings, per diem allowances, and securing conference rooms for interviews.
Several names and email addresses are redacted or partially obscured, indicating the correspondence is among government officials handling the sensitive investigation.
